titles.title: Recruiting Individuals to Drive Our Elders Act of 2014
RIDE Act of 2014

A bill to provide reimbursement under the Medicaid program to individuals and entities that provide voluntary non-emergency medical transportation to Medicaid beneficiaries for expenses related to no-load travel.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

term.name: Department of Health and Human Services
Social work, volunteer service, charitable organizations

bill.summary: 1/16/2014--Introduced. Recruiting Individuals to Drive Our Elders Act of 2014 or RIDE Act of 2014 - Directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services (HHS) to publish an interim final rule to revise certain Medicaid transportation regulations to allow a state plan under title XIX (Medicaid) of the Social Security Act to provide, at state option, reimbursement for costs attributable to providing no-load volunteer travel services to Medicaid-eligible individuals who require transportation to receive non-emergency medical treatment.
